title: How does my brain work?
description: How exactly does the brain -- a 3-pound snarl of nervous tissue -- create inspired inventions, the feeling of hunger, the experience of beauty, the sense of self? Researchers at the edge of science explain …

title: Tech breakthrough
description: These onstage demos offer a mind-blowing peek at where technology is taking us. Flying robots, levitating superconductors, brainwave-reading headsets and more …

title: The artist is in.
description: Why create? Artists and designers share their work, their process and their vision in these deeply personal -- and often hilarious -- talks.

title: What makes you happy?
description: Everyone wants to be happy. But how, exactly, does one go about it?  Here, psychologists, journalists, Buddhist monks and more gives answers that may surprise.

title: Insects are awesome!
description: Bugs! Some say they're a nuisance, but we think they're a wonder. These insect-obsessed speakers share how ants form societies, how bees pollinate flowers, and how termites can be quite ... tasty.

title: Sex: Can we talk?
description: A few things you've always wanted to know about sex: why we enjoy it, how to explain it, and, importantly, how flowers do it.

title: Ocean wonders
description: Dive into the unexplored universe beneath the waves: the beautiful, fragile (and sometimes terrifying) world of the ocean.

title: A better you
description: Ready for a change? These well-researched (and heartfelt) talks offer ideas and inspiration for all aspects of your life, from creativity to vulnerability, from competitive sports to collaborative games.

title: All kinds of minds
description: These powerful stories shatter preconceived notions about mental illness, and pose the provocative question: What can the world learn from different kinds of minds?

title: Who are the hackers?
description: The Internet connects us as never before, but there's a dark side to this web. Who are the hackers who wreak havoc online? And what is it they want? Sociologists, criminologists and hackers themselves shed light …

title: The creative spark
description: What makes us create and innovate? Here, wildly creative thinkers share ideas and insights into what kindles genius.

title: Freedom rising
description: From the Arab Spring to the emerging democracies of Eastern Europe, a new generation of freedom fighters -- entrepreneurs, journalists, activists -- shares powerful stories of resistance against dictatorships and oppression.

title: Open-source, open world
description: Embrace our wide-open shareable future -- where everything's hackable and the power of the crowd propels innovation.

title: Are you there, God?
description: For as many people as there are on Earth, there are as many answers to the question: Are you there, God? These talks offer personal perspectives on faith from all ends of the spectrum, from ardent Atheists to devout believers.

title: The pursuit of justice
description: Behold, courage. These speakers have the fortitude to stand up to some of the world's greatest injustices.

title: Way, way out there
description: Travel across the universe (or is it universes?) as star-gazing speakers share stunning images of Saturn's rings, haunting sounds from distant black holes and an infectious sense of wonder about what lies beyond our skies.

title: How to live with robots
description: As machines grow ever more intelligent, they're emerging not just as powerful tools, but close companions. These talks -- while offering some whizzy demos -- examine how robots are becoming an intimate part of our lives.

title: Virtuosos
description: Stunning performances straight from the TED stage. These musicians will transport you with their instrumental mastery.

title: Did you know?
description: A delightfully useful collection of explanations, how-tos and amusing trivia.

title: Where do ideas come from?
description: How does the metaphorical lightbulb go off? Is it a flash of genius? The power of crowds? These heady talks explore the nature of ideas themselves: Where they come from, how they evolve, and how each of us can nurture them.

title: Media with meaning
description: In a world filled with sound bites and paparazzi-snapped photos, there are still storytellers determined to create media with meaning. From feature films to citizen journalism, their work is worth spreading.

title: The road to peace
description: Peace. It's humanity's eternal, elusive dream. These speakers offer inspired ideas, practical advice and real-world examples from around the globe of how it just might be attainable.

title: The future of medicine
description: Take this tour of medicine's future with some of the trailblazing doctors charting its course. Once you've seen a transplantable human kidney created from a 3D printer, almost anything is imaginable ...

title: Re-imagining school
description: All over the world, there's a growing consensus that our education systems are broken. These educators offer lessons in how we might re-imagine school.

title: Architectural inspiration
description: Master architects share their vision for buildings that inflate, float, twist and glitter, while artfully addressing the challenges faced by their residents, their cities and the planet.

title: Our digital lives
description: Our hyper-connected lives have been rewired for the digital age. These talks explore how the Internet and social media are shaping our relationships, personal lives and sense of self.

title: To boldly go ...
description: Ski to the North Pole. Row across the Pacific. Swim on Mt. Everest(!). These adventurers have pushed themselves to the limits of human endurance, and in these talks they share what they've learned about themselves and the planet.

title: Sustainability by design
description: Humans are builders and creators—but how can we build thoughtfully, without waste? These talks explore sustainable design—both past and present—and its beautiful, inspiring results.

title: Our future in cities
description: Humanity's future is the future of cities. Explore the crowded favelas, greened-up blocks and futuristic districts that could shape the future of cities -- and take a profane, hilarious side trip to the suburbs.

title: Natural wonder
description: What is nature? Follow the camera's eye to many stunning places on the planet -- from the African veldt to the Amazon rainforest to the teeming world under the Arctic ice.

title: Jill Bolte Taylor: 10 talks on human nature
description: What moves Jill Bolte Taylor? "I love talks that contribute to the overall well-being of who we are as humanity -- about how we can explore ourselves as people in relationship with one another and with this beautiful planet."

title: Ben Affleck: 8 talks that amazed me
description: Browse Ben Affleck's super 8, and his director's notes on why he picked them.

title: Reggie Watts: 9 mind-boggling talks
description: Droids, mushrooms, pranks, fractals -- Reggie Watts shares some simple tools for brain expansion.

title: Glenn Close: The talks that moved me
description: Glenn Close shares 5 TED Talks that had a lasting effect on her, and luminous notes on why each one struck a chord.

title: Bill Gates: My 13 favorite talks
description: When we asked Bill Gates to curate a list of his favorite talks, his first response was, “There are too many to pick, really.” Here, he's whittled it down to 13 essentials.

title: Damon Lindelof: 5 talks I sent to friends
description: Why these talks, Damon Lindelof, writer of "Lost" and "Prometheus"? “These are the ones that stayed with me. That I watched more than once. That I have forwarded to friends with hopes of not only expanding their horizons but stimulating conversation.”

title: Elif Shafak: 7 truly captivating talks
description: Novelist Elif Shafak says, “Even long after I listened to these talks, I noticed I was carrying the words with me wherever I traveled. I can listen to these speakers again and again, hearing something new each time.”

title: Hans Rosling: 5 talks on global issues
description: Data visionary Hans Rosling's favorite talks keep an eye toward health, economics and population growth -- from business in Africa to youth culture in China.

title: Mikko Hypponen: 9 talks on tech … and fish
description: Mikko Hypponen lays it out: “The talks I chose for my playlist are about technology, security or privacy. Because geeks. Then I added the talk from Dan Barber. Because fish.”

title: Isaac Mizrahi: Talks that are in fashion
description: Designer Isaac Mizrahi dashed off these stylish, breezy notes on why these 6 TEDTalks are a source of inspiration for him.

title: Stefan Sagmeister: My all-time favorites
description: Stefan Sagmeister prefers to watch with company: “I find watching TED Talks the most brilliant alternative to watching TV, especially with someone else while stopping and going and stopping and discussing it all.”

title: Tim O'Reilly: 9 talks that stretched my mind
description: Tim O’Reilly of O’Reilly Media ("Make:" magazine, anyone?) shares his favorite TED Talks with notes about why each one had an impact. Surprise: It's not all tech.

title: Brandon Boyd: 9 eye-opening talks
description: Brandon Boyd, lead singer of Incubus, says, "I hope to one day perform live music on the moon. Perhaps if all goes according to plan, we can make a TED Talk out of it!" We eagerly await this event. Until then, here are his favorite talks.

title: Ryuichi Sakamoto: On music and more
description: Musician Ryuichi Sakamoto picks his favorite talks on ideas -- both musical and beyond. "Each talk expresses a vision no one else can have," he says. "They're a triumph of uniqueness and originality.”

title: Alexis Ohanian: 9 talks about the Internet
description: Reddit co-founder Alexis Ohanian picks 9 talks on the global idea flow. He says, "On an open Internet, where all links are created equal, good ideas win. Anyone, anywhere can share an idea that can be seen by millions."

title: Philippe Starck: 11 truly thrilling talks
description: Designer Philippe Starck handpicked this list of talks about science and design -- ideas that spur imagination and inspire creativity.

title: Dave Eggers: 4 talks that are spot-on
description: As Dave Eggers says, "The best TED Talks make sense of complicated ideas and trends, and have an elegant simplicity to them. It’s plenty of time to get across a clear and bold idea.” Below, his notes on 4 great talks.

title: Barbra Streisand: 8 must-see talks for women
description: An advocate for women's health, Barbra Streisand founded the Barbra Streisand Women’s Heart Center -- whose director is TEDxWomen star Dr. C. Noel Bairey Merz. Together they pick some great talks for women and, really, anyone.

title: Bobak Ferdowsi: On our home in the universe
description: NASA engineer Bobak Ferdowsi helped the Curiosity rover land on Mars -- and he's fascinated by talks that deepen our understanding of the world around us.

title: Daryl Hannah: 11 talks that inspired me
description: Daryl Hannah gathers TED Talks that span the globe, from the Black Hills Mountains of the United States to the underwater worlds of Antarctica.

title: Steve Case: 10 unforgettable talks
description: Steve Case says, “It has been amazing to watch TED's transition from party to platform, and from a small gathering for the benefit of a few to a massive global movement. Choosing my favorite TED Talks after so many years was no easy task, but here goes … ”

title: Peter Gabriel: 11 surprising talks
description: We asked Peter Gabriel what TEDTalks he thinks will still be making waves in 25 years, like his classic 1986 album, "So." Here are his picks, from printing a human kidney to the learning revolution.

title: Bono: 8 talks that give me hope
description: Bono picks 8 talks that express powerful ideas -- and shares exactly why each needs to be spread far and wide.

title: Wang Lifen: 5 highly quotable talks
description: A top newscaster in China, Wang Lifen has launche Umiwi to call on the youth of China to make their own media. Here, her 5 most quotable TED Talks.

title: Talks for foodies
description: What can compare to the pleasures of the palate? These talks from chefs, cookbook writers and passionate foodies celebrate all things edible.

title: Making sense of too much data
description: It's the age of Big Data. But what, exactly, do we do with all this information? These talks explore practical, ethical -- and spectacularly visual -- ways to understand near-infinite data.

title: Björk: 6 talks that are music to my ears
description: Björk picks 6 TED Talks that she simply adores, from a mushroom burial suit to a virtual choir of thousands.

title: The end of oil?
description: It's the question of our generation: Can we find a sustainable alternative to oil? Scientists, inventors and activists present stern warnings and visionary solutions for the energy of tomorrow.

title: Animals that amaze
description: Apes that write! Shrimp that kick! Octopi that disappear! These speakers show their obsessions with weird wild species of all sizes.

title: Work smarter
description: This isn't your father's business advice. These talks offer unconventional, and uncommonly useful, advice on leading, working and making the most of each day.

title: Objects of desire
description: An iconic painting. An ancient manuscript. A cylinder with 2600 years of history. Learn about artifacts and images that have intrigued humans for centuries, and why we find them so alluring.

title: How to tell a story
description: Why do we love our favorite stories? Do they need a beginning, middle and end, and a character who changes by the conclusion? Masters of storytelling explore new answers to age-old questions of the craft.

title: A cure for cancer?
description: Ridding the world of cancer: It's a far-flung dream, but that doesn't stop many from trying. Hear from researchers who've dedicated their lives and careers to understanding cancer, then ending it.

title: Might you live a great deal longer?
description: We're obsessed with age: Quests for youth, immortality and prolonged life are, indeed, ageless. Explore the science of longer lives ...

title: Personal tales from the edge of life
description: Beautiful, intimate and ultimately uplifting stories of challenge -- from making a new home in a strange country, to rebuilding life after unthinkable tragedy.

title: The power of film
description: Few things are as magical as sitting back in a theater with a hushed crowd to enjoy a film, but what you see on the screen isn't everything. Hear from visionaries -- from Hollywood, Bollywood, Nollywood -- on how to make movies.

title: The quest to end poverty
description: It's the challenge of our age: How do we end poverty? Hear ideas and results from economists, philanthropists, activists working -- in labs and on the ground -- to wipe it out.

title: Dinos!
description: Dinosaurs once roamed the Earth. What were they like, why did they disappear, and what can we learn from them?

title: War stories
description: We need to talk about war. These powerful, crucial talks come from soldiers, politicians, journalists and others who've seen the reality of war firsthand.

title: What doctors worry about
description: We worry about what our doctors will tell us -- and so do they. Doctors, scientists and medical researchers weigh in on health care and better health practices.

title: Can you believe your eyes?
description: Magic tricks, optical illusions, death-defying feats, digital lies. Believe it or not.

title: Close up and personal
description: These photographers capture beautiful but sobering images, using their art to help fight for social justice.

title: The global power shift
description: Big-picture talks about global politics and the shifting weight of the world.

title: Our brains: predictably irrational
description: The 3 pounds of jelly in our skulls allow us to reflect on our own consciousness -- and to make counterintuitive, irrational decisions. These talks explore why.

title: What's wrong with what we eat?
description: It's easy to worry about food: Are we eating the wrong stuff? What about people who don't have enough to eat? These talks examine the problems -- and some compelling solutions.

title: Macy Gray: My 4 favorite talks
description: Macy Gray's voice just does something for us. Here, the singer and activist picks four talks she would never try to say goodbye to.

title: 11 must-see TED Talks
description: What is TED? This primer of 11 classic TED Talks show you the wide range of topics covered -- and introduce you to beloved speakers like Amy Cuddy, Brené Brown, Sir Ken Robinson and Chimamanda Adichie. Find your next favorite talk ...

title: Climate change: Oh, it's real.
description: We still have a lot to learn about climate change, about why it's happening and what that means. But one thing is clear: It's real, alright. These talks provide a primer on the issue of our times.

title: Maestros, if you please ... !
description: These extraordinary maestros bring you into the world of writing and conducting music.

title: Design of useful things
description: Quirky, fascinating talks about the design of practical things we all need, whether we know it or not.

title: TED in 3 minutes
description: Hungry for inspiration but short on time? Watch these snack-sized talks.

title: Are we alone in the universe?
description: Is Earth really the only life-sustaining planet in existence? These speakers think there might just be something or someone else out there, and urge us not to stop the search.

title: Planes, trains and automobiles
description: Drive a plane? Race a car with your eyes closed? Fly? Innovators in transportation show that getting from point A to point B doesn't have to be boring.

title: Ancient clues
description: Fascinating talks by archaeologists and evolutionary biologists about humanity's beginnings and journey.

title: What does the future look like?
description: Visions of the future, on everything from cars to the Internet to the human species.

title: Talks to watch with kids
description: Fun, informative and captivating talks to inspire young minds.

title: Spoken-word fireworks
description: Brave and beautiful expressions from some of the world's most talented spoken-word performers, who weave stories in words and gestures.

title: That's absurd!
description: These quirky talks remind us that life is funny, weird, sweet, absurd.

title: Sugata Mitra's 5 favorite education talks
description: 2013 TED Prize winner Sugata Mitra is an educator who helps kids learn to teach themselves. Here are 5 talks that align with his vision of education's future.

title: Everything you thought ... was wrong
description: 10 counterintuitive talks to flip your thinking on everything from shoes to aid organizations to the universe.

title: Listen up
description: Talks on the importance of listening, and how to do it much better.

title: GROSS!
description: Poop, parasites, dead duck sex, eating bugs, and many more impolite -- but fascinating -- topics.

title: Words, words, words
description: As Wittgenstein wrote, "The limits of my language mean the limits of my world." Watch talks by linguists, data analysts and word nerds.

title: Plantastic!
description: Green, leafy, often delicious: Plants are all around us and make the ecosystem work. Hear from gardeners, vegetarians, designers and conservationists on the wonderful world of plants and vegetables.

title: Ramsey Musallam: 6 talks that blew me away
description: Chemistry teacher Ramsey Musallam knows that great educational media can be nothing short of explosive. Strap on your goggles and watch his top picks.

title: Geoffrey Canada: 7 talks on social change
description: Educator and activist Geoffrey Canada chose a powerful list of favorites — talks that address the cycles of poverty and gender violence, and offer bold suggestions for change.

title: Malcolm London: 4 talks that speak out
description: As important as they are eloquent, these four talks are poet Malcolm London’s idea of how to truly cause a stir.

title: Pearl Arredondo: 8 talks to spark success
description: Pearl Arredondo worked her way up from humble East L.A. beginnings, and as a high school teacher she now inspires other kids to do the same. Here are the talks that she thinks capture that spirit of drive and determination.

title: Angela Duckworth: 4 talks on human behavior
description: Psychologist Angela Duckworth studies the traits that allow us to stick to our goals — and she chose four great talks that explore other facets of how human beings behave.

title: Ken Robinson: 10 talks on education
description: Education legend Sir Ken Robinson picked the talks he loves — all full of insight, bright ideas and, of course, creativity.

title: TV Special: TED Talks Education
description: How can we create an education system that works for kids, instead of against them? Watch eight inspiring talks (and one beautiful performance) from TED's May 2013 PBS special, given in their entirety.

title: The big picture
description: Must-listen talks about the future of the environment, crime, technology, government and the human race.

title: Design giants
description: From graphics to products, check out these talks by some of the world's greatest designers.

title: The world of tiny things
description: Zoom in -- way, way in -- to look at the world from speck's-eye view. Learn about very tiny insects, the world at the nanoscale, and sculptures so small it's best to hold your breath while viewing.

title: TED under 20
description: Talks from scientists, musicians, innovators -- all in their teens. Watch these amazing wunderkinds.

title: The dark side of data
description: Data can be used for good, harnessed for the betterment of society, but it can also be abused. Find out about some hidden not-so-sunny uses of Big Data.

title: Carlton Cuse: 6 talks that help me create
description: "These talks have inspired me to create, in my writing or in my life," says Carlton Cuse, screenwriter and producer of "Lost" and "Bates Motel." "These speakers have 'passionate optimism' -- that inner drive that allows us to risk truly expressing ourselves.”

title: Ryan Coogler: 6 talks that inspired me
description: Ryan Coogler, director of "Fruitvale Station," picks his 6 favorite talks. He also calls out Steve Jobs' "How to Live Before You Die," calling it: "One of the best speeches given during my lifetime. Jobs gives a personal meditation on what it means to be human."

title: Dan Pink: My 5 favorite talks on work
description: Popular business author Dan Pink picks his 5 favorite TED Talks on how to find greater success at work.

title: Diane von Furstenberg's 5 favorite TED Talks
description: The legendary fashion designer — who created the wrap dress and remains an icon in the industry (she's also President of the Council of Fashion Designers of America) — picks the 5 TED talks that have inspired her most.

title: Will drones save us or destroy us?
description: Depending on who you listen to, drones will either save the world -- or usher in our techno-driven doom. Here, take a look at the light and dark side of drones. See exclusive articles on the TED blog.

title: Jamie Oliver: 5 talks that inspired me
description: Jamie Oliver came to fame as the Naked Chef -- now he's made it his mission to transform the way we feed ourselves and our children, through his cookbooks, TV shows and the Jamie Oliver Food Foundation. The 2010 TED Prize winner shares his 5 favorite talks.

title: Work happier
description: Happiness leads to better work -- not the other way around. We learned this from Shawn Achor's TED Talk. Here that classic, plus his selects of other talks to make business more positive.

title: Adventures in mapping
description: Maps don’t just tell you which street to turn left on. Maps convey information that shapes our lives, deepen our understanding of problems and our ability to create solutions, and whisk our imaginations to new lands. See what we mean, below.

title: Social Good, Inc.
description: Businesses have the resources to make contributions to the collective good. Here, TED Talks on what can happen when corporations make saving the environment and helping people a priority, plus talks on how business principles might even be more effective for creating change than non-profit models.

title: How to be a great leader
description: What makes a great leader? The ability to rule with an iron fist? Being well-liked? Or maybe just having a really loud voice? These TED speakers each offer much more nuanced approaches on how to inspire others.

title: MOOCs 101
description: Given that it’s the internet age and all, why should classrooms look exactly the way they have for centuries? Here, TED speakers on what can happen when we bring education online … and open it up to anyone.

title: The forecast calls for…
description: Why is it that the weather is so often a subject of conversation? Because it’s a shared experience amongst all those around us. Here, talks about the weather.

title: In the mood for love
description: Love: it’s what makes the world go round. And also: all you need. As well as that thing, in addition to war, in which all is fair. Here, TED Talks about this most basic of human emotions.

title: Should we redesign humans?
description: The age of bioengineering is upon us, with scientists' understanding of how to engineer cells, tissues and organs improving at a rapid pace. Here, how this could affect the future of our physical bodies.

title: David Blaine: My favorite talks
description: For the last 17 years, I’ve had the good fortune of participating in TED, both as a listener and a speaker. The talks often move me to tears. Listening to stories of passion, dedication and triumph remind me of how truly amazing humans can be. Below are some of my favorites.

title: Craftsmanship
description: What feels so good about getting your hands dirty and making something? The following talks speak to the art of craft.

title: 30 years of TED
description: The first TED was held in 1984. What kind of predictions did people make 30 years ago? (And did they turn out to be right?) Watch the world change over three decades in this nearly year-by-year playlist.

title: Depths of corruption
description: Corruption manifests itself in many ways, some subtler than others. From anonymous companies to bribes to unjust electoral systems, these talks take you deep into ethically murky territory … and offer bold ideas on what we can do about it.

title: South America!
description: Creativity and innovation are flowing in South America, while countries across the continent still face unique challenges. As we plan for TEDGlobal 2014—happening in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, in October—this playlist will get you in the spirit.

title: Advice to help you be a great parent
description: Kids don’t come with a manual, and parents don’t get grades to affirm they’re doing things right. These talks speak to the complexities of parenthood, offering unusual insights and hard-won advice.

title: Earth, appreciated
description: Our planet is a wonder, a perfectly improbable incubator for life. It’s also in danger because of our indifference. Reflections on both those truths.

title: What is success?
description: Success can mean: feeling that tingle of excitement about what you do, sticking with what matters through hard times, living a life you can feel proud of in retrospect. These talks say it all.

title: The autism spectrum
description: As autism diagnoses rise, it’s become a topic many are thinking about. Here, talks on the science of autism, as well as first-person accounts from those living with it.

title: How do you solve a problem like the climate crisis?
description: We all know about the climate crisis. We all want to stay informed — but the information can be overwhelming. Watch these talks to hear what’s at stake and find out what's being done.

title: Calling all sports fans
description: Whether you love to swim, run, ski, shoot hoops or play cricket, these talks will make you wish you had a foam finger to hoist in the air.

title: The Remix
description: DJs make remixes, cross-pollinating old sounds with new. But all of us engage in this conversation between the past and present, making ideas resonate over and over again.

title: Graduation…now what?
description: After you swing your mortarboard tassel from right to left, your sense of excitement can give way to a sense of normlessness. For anyone feeling that, these talks offer exquisite insight.

title: A trip to the museum
description: Wandering a museum hall can whisk you off to another time, leave you in awe of an artist or teach you something new about our natural world. Enjoy these talks about museums.

title: Toys!
description: What’s more fun than a barrel of monkeys? These talks, which offer unique insights on the things we play with—from teddy bears to Legos to yo-yos.

title: 7 talks to make you love science
description: Science is about discovering the wonders of how our world works. From physics to biology to neuroscience, channel your inner Mr. Wizard as you watch these talks.

title: How we make choices
description: Illuminating talks on why some choices are so tough and how we can choose to make better ones. (Or are we in control of our own choices at all?)

title: Life in—and after—prison
description: More than 2.3 million people in the United States are in prison or jail. Here, talks that speak to the experience of life behind bars—and different perspectives on what can make it a rehabilitating experience.

title: Why we need brave journalists
description: Three reporters who've been arrested, shot at and threatened talk about why they continue to report in dangerous war zones, prisons, protest sites -- because otherwise, these stories will go untold.

title: Charming talks for a boost on a bad day
description: Bad days happen to good people. Here are talks guaranteed to help cheer you up.

title: The first 6 TED Talks ever
description: Behold, the very first TED Talks posted online, shared with the world on June 27, 2006. Each is powerful and moving -- and still deeply resonates today.

title: Kickstart your creativity
description: Out of fresh ideas? These inspiring talks offer the kick-in-the-pants you need to unleash your creative spirit.

title: The most popular talks of all time
description: Are schools killing creativity? What makes a great leader? How can I find happiness? These 20 talks are the ones that you and your fellow TED fans just can't stop sharing.

title: Talks to give you wanderlust
description: Prepare to be swept away with longing for distant places. Hit play on these talks while you pack your real or imaginary bags for an epic journey.

title: Fascinating psych experiments
description: Human behavior is a riddle. In these talks, speakers share psychological studies—from asking kids to wait to eat marshmallows to planting false memories through a single word—that offer possible solutions as well as surprising new twists.

title: Surprisingly viral TED Talks
description: How did some of our quirkiest talks pull in millions of views? Watch these fun, fascinating hits and see for yourself.

title: The struggle of mental health
description: Depression, schizophrenia, suicidal feelings—too often, these experiences stay private. These speakers who’ve struggled with mental illness boldly share their stories, in hopes that others don’t feel so alone.

title: Smart kids’ life advice
description: These young speakers encourage us to ask bold questions, think creatively and dream big. It’s spot-on life advice that adults may just want to listen to.

title: Talks to take you back to school
description: Sharpen your pencils! It’s time to hit the books again, with these TED Talks that take you through a busy day of math, history, gym, lunch, English, science and art. No finals required.

title: The 10 most popular TEDx talks
description: TEDx events unleash fresh ideas from local communities. Close to 50,000 talks have been given at 10,000 events since the program launched in 2009. Below, the 10 most-watched TEDx talks posted to our homepage.

title: The most popular science talks
description: Spellbinding, stimulating, seductive … science? Here, the 10 most-watched science talks on TED.com. See why.

title: Talks from inspiring teachers
description: A great teacher can change the trajectory of your life. Here, talks from 8 teachers you'll wish you had.

title: Ryan Holladay's playlist
description: Explore the transforming power of music.

title: Robert Simpson's playlist
description: Huge ideas from physics.

title: Cesar Harada's playlist
description: Inspiration from the ocean and on dry land.

title: Andrew Bastawrous's playlist
description: Visionaries exploring sight and vision.

title: Insights on terrorism
description: It’s a solemn subject—one of the harsh realities of our world. Here, speakers with insightful thoughts on why terrorism continues … and what we can do to stop it.

title: Math talks to blow your mind
description: Numbers, patterns and equations are at the core of these talks, which will teach you how to fold better origami and how to quantify history.

title: The perfect lunchtime talks
description: Need something smart to chew on? As you eat lunch, cue up these delightful talks, as invigorating for the mind as a cup of coffee.

title: Stand up to bullying
description: Sometimes bullying is verbal—an upsetting nickname, a disheartening taunt. Other times it’s physical. These speakers' words might just stop it in all forms.

title: 10 talks by women that everyone should watch
description: Color bravery. A headset for brainwaves. His/hers healthcare. 10 big, bold talks from female speakers.

title: The importance of educating girls
description: In far too many countries around the world, an education is not a given for girls. These moving talks are from those facing great risk to change that.

title: 10 talks from authors
description: These well-known writers weave beautiful words on the page … and on the stage.

title: 7 talks with insights on breast cancer
description: Breast cancer is the most common cancer among women worldwide. Listen as cancer researchers, doctors, technologists and, oh, a dancer, share their perspectives — and learnings — on this disease.

title: The complexity of memory
description: The mind is a diligent recorder, taking note of all that happens and storing data on it for retrieval later, right? Well actually, no. Enjoy these 7 illuminating talks on the science—and oddities—of our memory.

title: Talks to restore your faith in politics
description: Modern politics turns you off? Here’s how to reconnect — and take charge of your world.

title: Spooky, creepy talks for Halloween
description: While you carve your pumpkins and put the final touches on your costume, these talks will get you into the Halloween spirit.

title: Take charge of your healthcare
description: You may be the patient. But that doesn’t mean you shouldn’t be an active participant in getting the best possible care. These speakers have ideas on how.

title: Talks to make your commute go faster
description: These engrossing stories will make your drive -- or train ride -- fly by. You'll laugh, you'll cry, you won't feel an ounce of road rage. And you won't miss a thing if you can't watch the visuals.

title: Art made of data
description: Seeing patterns and creating beauty -- data visualization has become an art form. Meet pioneering artists who use spreadsheets, archives and digital data as their paints and canvas.

title: Talks that just might save your relationship
description: No matter how long you've been together, it never hurts to have a little refresher course on what really matters.

title: The best mustaches on TED.com
description: These speakers sport impressive moustaches. Watch in honor of Movember, the month in which men let their ‘staches grow wild to raise money for men’s health causes.

title: Slow down! Enjoy life.
description: The world is moving fast. These talks will inspire you to take time to process it all. Bonus reading: Pico Iyer’s The Art of Stillness, a beautiful meditation on this subject.

title: 9 trippy TED Talks
description: These surprising, slightly psychedelic talks are better than staring at a blacklight poster.

title: Give thanks
description: These TED Talks will help you conjure up massive amounts of gratitude.

title: Talks to watch instead of shopping
description: Forget about Black Friday. Step away from the mall and watch these talks on consumerism … and why it’s not always the best thing.

title: 10 ideas for ending HIV/AIDS
description: These powerful talks offer ideas for rethinking—and hopefully stopping—the spread of HIV and AIDS.

title: Counterintuitive career advice
description: You know how to write a resume and ask for a promotion. These talks go beyond the basics, offering insightful advice on how to think about our work lives.

title: Talks to watch when every conceivable bad thing has just happened to you
description: When it rains, it tends to pour. Here’s hoping that a break in the clouds is coming soon.

title: The art of meaningful conversation
description: You talk to people everyday. But do you really feel like you’re communicating? These talks will help you go beyond small talk, to the conversations that nudge along understanding.

title: Unsolved Mysteries
description: We all love parsing the twists and folds of a good old-fashioned mystery -- of all kinds. ("Serial" lovers, this playlist is for you.)

title: How (and why) to forgive
description: Forgiveness sounds so easy, and yet it's tough to muster in practice. These talks may help.

title: On generosity
description: It’s the giving season. And thus, we give you these great talks on the hows, whys and whats of generosity.

title: The most popular talks of 2014
description: From overcoming adversity to the latest in tech—these are the talks you binge-watched this year.

title: Talks to restore your faith in humanity
description: Sometimes it’s easy to think the worst of human beings. But these inspiring talks can help you remember: altruism, kindness and helping hands are all around.

title: Talks to inspire New Year's Resolutions
description: New Year's resolutions are easy to make … and hard to keep. Our advice: Make resolutions that reflect your core values, to be kinder, more confident, more open to change. Some inspiration:

title: Get in shape (for real this time)
description: It is the New Year’s Resolution that you make over and over again. Here, talks to help you actually stick to it—and do it in a kind, effective way.

title: 10 talks you won't be able to stop thinking about
description: Once you watch these talks, you may not be able to get them out of your head. These talks have staying power and, as you go about everyday life, we bet you'll find yourself thinking of them often.

title: 7 talks to help you find the right job
description: You want work that makes you feel happy, challenged, appreciated, and like you are making a positive contribution. Below, talks for the job hunt to help you find that elusive combination.

title: Short talks for parents who are short on time but starved for intellectual stimulation
description: You aren't sleeping. You barely have time to eat, let alone peruse TED Talks. Here, talks under six minutes that will give you a quick dose of inspiration.

title: 5 talks on the truth about lying
description: We're lied to 10 to 200 times a day, and tell a lie ourselves an average of 1 to 2 times in the same period. These talks will help you understand why — and will make you better at sussing out the truth.

title: Talks to inspire you to go to bed and get a good night's sleep
description: Far better than counting sheep, these talks on the importance of sleep may well help you get your zzzzs tonight.

title: Grow your own stuff
description: You’ve heard of ‘do it yourself,’ but what about ‘grow it yourself?’ Enjoy these quirky talks full of possibilities.

title: Talks to get you through your quarter-life crisis
description: Yes, you're an adult now. But there's no need to panic! Take a deep breath and survive twenty-something burnout with the help of these talks.

title: Before public speaking…
description: If you’ve got a presentation to give at work or school — or are perhaps getting ready to speak at a TEDx event? — we recommend these talks to help get you pumped up.

title: Talks to make you feel good about getting older
description: The extra candles on the birthday cake, the little lines you notice in the mirror ... aging doesn’t always feel good. But remember, age also brings wisdom and balance. Watch these reminders of the benefits that come with age.

title: How language changes over time
description: Language isn’t fixed—it evolves. Enjoy these talks on the shifts happening before our eyes, for better or worse.

title: The 10 TED Talks you’ve commented on the most
description: These talks sparked lively discussion on TED.com — each has more than 1500 comments. Perhaps you'll be inspired to share your own perspective, be it agreement or a challenge.

title: 10 great talks to celebrate Black History Month
description: These fascinating talks offer fresh perspectives on black identity, and fascinating insights on how to finally defeat racism.

title: The weird science of love
description: Love often feels inexplicable, the most unpredictable of forces. Using science, math and methodical observation, these speakers offer clues to understanding it.

title: Talks to help you forget that you're doing chores
description: Whether you are washing dishes, dusting the shelves or cleaning the car, these talks will help the next hour and a half fly by. No need to watch—just listen.

title: Words to live by
description: These speakers offer beautiful, sweeping, simple life advice — the kind to tuck in the back of your mind and let inspire you onward.

title: Talks to help you shake off rejection
description: Everyone faces rejection, sometimes on repeat. These speakers experienced a barrage of ‘no’s, but were able to push past the disappointment and keep on going. May their resilience inspire you.

title: The funniest TED Talks
description: Great TED Talks illuminate an idea. Sometimes, they do it while making you laugh. These talks will bring a smile to your face. Please note: Vigorous debate ensued among our staff about which talks to include. So we hope you’ll find something for every sense of humor.

title: Truth and dare
description: TED2015 transforms the “or” in the classic party game name into “and.” Why? Because truth often requires us to be daring, and daring often leads us to new truths. Talks to help you get in the spirit for TED2015...
